generated_answer: People feel lonely when they lack meaningful social interactions or connections. It may also occur when they feel unwanted, unloved or not respected by others. This can be due to various reasons such as not being able to connect with people on a deeper level, or not being able to find people whose ideas or beliefs align with theirs.

generated_answer: Someone can improve their social skills by first recognizing the importance of these skills in daily life. They should practice more often by interacting with various people in different settings. They can try going out more and pushing themselves to engage with others, even if they find it difficult. Developing sensitivity to others' emotions and needs, learning how to properly give criticism without offending, and understanding how to work well with others are crucial aspects of improving social skills.
